definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To bend (any thin material , such as paper) over so that it comes in contact with itself.
( transitive ) To make the proper arrangement (in a thin material) by bending.
examples: If you fold the sheets, they'll fit more easily in the drawer.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To draw or coil (one’s arms, a snake’s body, etc.) around something so as to enclose or embrace it.
( transitive , cooking ) To stir (semisolid ingredients) gently, with an action as if folding over a solid.
examples: Fold the egg whites into the batter.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To become folded; to form folds.
( intransitive , informal ) To fall over ; to collapse or give way ; to be crushed .
examples: The chair folded under his enormous weight.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To give way on a point or in an argument.
( intransitive , poker ) To withdraw from betting .
examples: With no hearts in the river and no chance to hit his straight, he folded .

definitions.definition: ( intransitive , by extension ) To withdraw or quit in general.
( intransitive ) To fail , to collapse , to disband .
( intransitive , business ) Of a company, to cease to trade.
examples: The company folded after six quarters of negative growth.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To double or lay together (one’s arms, hands, wings, etc.) so as to overlap with each other.
examples: He folded his arms in defiance.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , obsolete ) To plait or mat (hair) together .
( transitive ) To enclose in a fold of material, to swathe , wrap up , cover , enwrap .
( transitive ) To enclose within folded arms, to clasp , to embrace ( see also enfold ).
( transitive , figuratively ) To cover up , to conceal .
( transitive , obsolete ) To ensnare , to capture .
( transitive , computing ) To split (a line of text) across multiple lines, to obey line length limitations.

definitions.definition: To confine (animals) in a fold, to pen in .
To include in a spiritual ‘ flock ’ or group of the saved , etc.
To place sheep on (a piece of land) in order to manure it.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To confine (animals) in a fold, to pen in .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figuratively ) To include in a spiritual ‘ flock ’ or group of the saved , etc.
( transitive ) To place sheep on (a piece of land) in order to manure it.
